Class Prompt

java.lang.Object
Prompt
public class Prompt extends Object
The prompt class contains all the prompts for the user that are called on repeatedly in the program, it also contains methods to get user decisions.

  • Constructor Details

    • Prompt

      public Prompt()

  • Method Details

    • initialPrompt

      public void initialPrompt()
      This is the initial prompt that is displayed when the user opens the program. It contains all the operations they may want the program to do including closing it.

    • areYouSureDeletePrompt

      public void areYouSureDeletePrompt(String entity)
      This method prompts the user to state whether they are sure they want to delete an entity from a table with the options yes and no where 1 is yes and 2 is no.
      Parameters:
      entity - name of entity being deleted

    • personPrompt

      public void personPrompt()
      This prompts the user to choose between a customer, architect or contractor It is used when the user wants to delete, update or enter a new person to the database. 1 is customer, 2 is architect and 3 is contractor.

    • nameProjNumPrompt

      public void nameProjNumPrompt()
      This method prompts the user to choose between searching for a project based on project number or name

    • editEntityOrIdPromptTwoOptions

      public void editEntityOrIdPromptTwoOptions(String entityBeingAskedAbout)
      This method prompts the user to choose between editing an entity or choosing from another in the database. This is used when editing a project's customer or project address as they may not be null.
      Parameters:
      entityBeingAskedAbout - Entity to be edited or switched

    • editEntityOrIdPromptThreeOptions

      public void editEntityOrIdPromptThreeOptions(String entityBeingAskedAbout)
      This method prompts the used to choose between editing an entity, choosing from another in the database, or setting the id to null. This is used for architects and contractors as they may be null values (Maybe an architect left for some reason).
      Parameters:
      entityBeingAskedAbout - Entity to be edited, switched, or set to null

    • newEntityOrIdPromptTwoOptions

      public void newEntityOrIdPromptTwoOptions(String entityBeingAskedAbout)
      Method prompts the user to either enter a new entity or select an entity. This is used when the user creates a project and they must fill in either a new entity such as a project address or customer, or they must enter a new one.
      Parameters:
      entityBeingAskedAbout - Entity to be entered and added to the project

    • newEntityOrIdPromptThreeOptions

      public void newEntityOrIdPromptThreeOptions(String entityBeingAskedAbout)
      Method prompts the user to enter a new entity, select an ID, or leave the field null. This is used when creating a project and an architect or contractor is to be entered. They can be null as at the time of recording the data, a contractor or architect might not be chosen yet
      Parameters:
      entityBeingAskedAbout - Entity to be entered or left null on the project

    • getUserChoiceThreeOptions

      public String getUserChoiceThreeOptions(String userInput, Scanner scObj)
      Method which gets a user's response to a prompt where there are three options for them to choose from.
      Parameters:
      userInput - The user's input variable
      scObj - The scanner to get the user's inputs
      Returns:
      The user's choice as a String

    • getUserChoiceTwoOptions

      public String getUserChoiceTwoOptions(String userInput, Scanner scObj)
      Method which gets a user's response to a prompt where there are two options for them to choose from.
      Parameters:
      userInput - The user's input variable
      scObj - The scanner to get the user's inputs
      Returns:
      The user's choice as a String

    • getUserChoiceSixOptions

      public String getUserChoiceSixOptions(String userInput, Scanner scObj)
      Method which gets a user's response to a prompt where there are six options for them to choose from.
      Parameters:
      userInput - The user's input variable
      scObj - The scanner to get the user's inputs
      Returns:
      The user's choice as a String
